intro: Muelleranthus trifoliolatus, commonly known as the three-leaved sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is an annual species that produces numerous small, showy flowers arranged in a composite head. The botanical features of Muelleranthus trifoliolatus make it well adapted to arid environments and contribute to its ecological significance in its native range.
